description.hltext_display: El periodismo toma las aulas
description.author: E. Blanco
description.content: Elaborar revistas y periódicos es una práctica a la que cada vez se suman más centros educativos pues son herramientas a través de las cuales sus alumnos pueden implicares más en el día a día de su instituto o su colegio.El último en sumarse a este tipo de iniciativas en La Línea de la Concepción ha sido el centro de Educación Especial Virgen del Amparo que comenzó a diseñar y escribir su propia publicación de periodicidad mensual a principios de este curso académico, por lo que ya hay tres números en la calle.La monitora de este taller Francisca Gálvez habló satisfecha e ilusionada del buen desarrollo de este proyecto que nació fruto de las ideas y el esfuerzo de profesores y monitores del Módulo de Transición a la Vida Adulta (Mtval) que se lleva a cabo en el Virgen del Amparo.En esta iniciativa participan unos 30 alumnos con discapacidad intelectual aproximadamente de seis clases distintas, con edades comprendidas entre los 12 y los 20 años.Historias Ampareñas, que así es como se llama, tiene una tirada mensual de más de 100 ejemplares, que se reparten entre los padres de alumnos, que a su vez son los que se encargan de que estos números corran de mano en mano en La Línea y de darle publicidad a este trabajo mediante el boca a boca.Número a número se muestra las actividades y talleres que se desarrollan en el centro, así como las opiniones de alumnos y profesores sobre distintos temas e información de carácter deportivo y cultural. También se informa en este número del escudo que se ha diseñado para el centro y que ha sido escogido por los propios alumnos mediante una votación.Francisca Gálvez explicó que el objetivo que se ha marcado la comunidad educativa del Virgen del Amparo es que los ciudadanos del "conozcan el colegio y sobre todo la capacidad que tienen sus alumnos, que pueden hacer muchas cosas que la gente no sabe".El último número de Historias Ampareñas recoge actividades teatrales, exposiciones realizadas en el municipio con motivo del Día de la Discapacidad, las recetas que aprenden a hacer los alumnos en el taller de cocina y hasta entrevistas.Una iniciativa cargada de buenos propósitos que ojalá dure muchísimo tiempo.Envía tus convocatorias a viviraqui@europasur.com

description.hltext_display: Anderlecht aast op Dries Mertens
description.author: redactie@voetbalbelgie.be
description.content:
Anderlecht wil graag Dries Mertens van FC Utrecht aantrekken, maar voor een transfer in januari staat de aanvallende middenvelder niet te springen. In de zomer van 2011 is een overgang wel bespreekbaar. Anderlecht drukt mogelijk pas door als Boussoufa zou vertrekken.
"Ik zie me nog niet meteen naar een groot kampioenschap vertrekken", aldus Dries Mertens zelf in Sportwereld. "Een tussenstap zou ideaal zijn. Anderlecht? Dat is een mooie club, maar aangezien de interesse niet concreet is, kan ik er niets meer over zeggen."
De 23-jarige Leuvenaar verlengde in de zomer van 2010 zijn contract in de Domstad tot medio 2014, maar staat dus niet weigerachtig tegenover een transfer op het einde van het seizoen.
Mertens speelde eerder al in de jeugd voor Anderlecht, dat hem destijds wegplukte bij Stade Leuven. Op zijn 16de trok Mertens naar AA Gent, dat hem later uitleende aan Eendracht Aalst. In 2066 koos Mertens voor een avontuur bij de Nederlandse tweedeklasser AGOVV Apeldoorn, waar Utrecht hem anno 2009 weghaalde. Een schot in de roos was dat. Mertens werd al verkozen tot tweede beste profspeler van Nederland.

description.hltext_display: Business Line
description.content:
MUNCIE Economic Development Alliance site honored
The website for the Muncie-Delaware County Economic Development Alliance has been honored.
The Mid-America Economic Development Council (MAEDC) presented its annual "Best of the Midwest" Economic Development awards at the 2010 Mid-America Competitiveness Conference & Site Selector Forum, held Dec. 5-7 at the Intercontinental Hotel in Chicago.
First place in the website category was awarded to the Muncie-Delaware County Economic Development Alliance for its website, www.muncie.com.
Traci Lutton, project manager for the alliance, was present to accept the award from Brian Vasa, 2010 MAEDC president, and Ron Starner, executive vice president and general manager, Site Selection magazine.
"The alliance took into consideration economic development best practices and the needs of multiple audiences including site location consultants, existing business owners, foreign investors, chamber of commerce members, and individuals seeking relocation information. The creation of a user-friendly, well-designed site that would provide comprehensive information to all potential audiences was the overall goal during the development process. Receiving the Best of the Midwest honor is validation that we achieved that goal. Special thanks goes to our partners on the project, Atlas Advertising Mark James, ED Solutions, and AEP," said Lutton. "The judges noted that they were impressed with the depth of information on the site, the excellent use of data standards, the customizable data cart with share and print functions, and the sites and buildings database."
"The Muncie-Delaware County website is a best-in-class economic development site. It has met or exceeded other sites in terms of solid mapping, accurate and complete sets of demographics, sites and building records and solid information about the organization and their services. I have no doubt the site is a huge asset for the organization," said Mark James of ED Solutions.

description.hltext_display: Shooter Forces Man To Ground Then Flees
description.content:
/p> DICKSON, Tenn. --
Witnesses say gunman randomly beat and shot a man before taking off into the woods.
"For nothing, for no reason? I mean, I don't know, that's weird," said Carmen Manning, who lives nearby.
It's a bizarre and violent case that has investigators baffled and Dickson County residents on edge.
"Oh my gosh, you know, it scared me," said Dickson County resident Pennie Gray.
"Just makes me worry my kids could be out and we got somebody out doing stuff like that," said Dickson County resident Larry Bruce.
Detectives said Holley Grammer was standing outside his home on Jessie Work Road Monday afternoon when a man, dressed in camouflage and with his face covered, came out of the woods with a gun.
Investigators said he fired shots into the air, forced Grammer onto the ground, beat him with the gun then shot him in the back.
"Any time you have someone shot it's disturbing, but to have them lay down on the ground like that, yeah it is disturbing," said Detective Mark Bausell, of the Dickson County Sheriff's Office.
Witnesses told investigators the gunman ran into the woods and has been on the run ever since.
"We did have a K-9 unit come back into the area and do a search, and we weren't able to locate any suspects in the wood line," said Bausell.
Perhaps the most frustrating part, detectives haven't determined a motive. Grammer wasn't robbed and said he doesn't know his attacker.
"We have no idea, no idea. Talking with the witnesses, including the victim, he has no problems with anyone in the area. It seems like everyone in the area likes him," said Bausell.
"You don't know what's going through their head. They could just be having a bad time or not on their medication or what not. It's scary for everybody," said Bruce.
Grammer was airlifted to Vanderbilt Hospital and is now in stable condition.
Deputies said they don't know if the gunman is still in the Dickson County area.
Copyright 2010 by WSMV.com. All rights reserved.
This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed.
Got a story idea? E-mail newstips to news@wsmv.com or call the newsroom 24/7 at 615-353-2231.

description.hltext_display: Avalia renueva el acuerdo de préstamos a pymes
description.content:
El consejero de Economía, Alberto Larraz, rubricó ayer con representantes de 16 entidades financieras la renovación del convenio especial de financiación, promovido por Avalia, para la concesión de crédito a las pymes y los autónomos aragoneses en condiciones mejores que las del mercado. En sus dos primeros años de funcionamiento, este acuerdo ha permitido el mantenimiento o la creación de casi 7.000 empleos en la comunidad, según explicó Larraz en la rueda de prensa posterior a la firma de los convenios.
El acuerdo fue suscrito por un periodo de dos años por representantes de Ibercaja, CAI, Caja Rural de Teruel, Cajalón, Multicaja, La Caixa, Banco Popular, Santander, Bankinter, Caja España-Caja Duero, Caja Laboral, Caja Navarra, Deutsche Bank, CajaMar, Caja Mediterráneo y Caja Vital.
El importe máximo de las operaciones es de 300.000 euros y se puede destinar tanto a la financiación de proyectos de I+D como a las necesidades de capital circulante. En sus dos años de vida, se han autorizado 352 operaciones (55 millones de euros). De ellas, 185 se otorgaron a pymes de la comunidad y el resto, a microempresas y autónomos.

description.hltext_display: Shop 'til you drop
description.content:
MUNCIE -- If you haven't polished off your Christmas shopping list yet, there's still time. Extra time, in fact.
Stores will be open extended hours this week, with Toys 'R' Us open around the clock until 10 p.m. Friday for Christmas Eve shopping.
At Muncie Mall -- where stores will be open until 10 p.m. or later through Thursday and until 6 p.m. on Christmas Eve -- shopping will continue right up until the last minute.
"We'll be very busy upon opening and pretty steady until we close," mall manager Stacey Nance said. "There are some years, even though we close at 6, we'll be selling gift cards past that. We don't want to turn anyone away."
Nance said mall stores have reported strong sales this year following two years of lackluster sales due to the national recession.
"I've had some stores that reported they've been number one in their district, even going up against Indianapolis stores," Nance said.
The brisk business isn't surprising to Ball State University economist Michael Hicks.
"The season looks to be a much better than forecasted," Hicks said. "The National Retail Federation upgraded their forecast from 2.3 to 3.3 percent based on November sales data. This is rare for them to change the forecast, much less by this amount. My forecast was also 2.3 percent, with expected big improvements in consumer electronics and clothing.
"Stores are really fighting aggressively on price for market share. This means that they don't yet feel demand is high and are trying to bring folks to the stores by slashing prices."
Toys 'R' Us has announced 50-percent savings on featured items, and most retailers are staging last-minute sales through Christmas Eve.
In addition to price cuts, stores are offering the convenience of long hours. J.C. Penney will be open 7 a.m.-midnight through Thursday and 7 a.m.-6 p.m. Friday, the retailer announced. Nance noted that most of Muncie Mall's anchor stores would have hours even beyond the mall's longer hours.
Toys 'R' Us also announced that, for the first time ever, its stores would be open 24 hours a day -- 88 consecutive hours -- through 10 p.m. Christmas Eve.
But will shoppers be able to find what they're looking for?
USA Today reported this week that some of the hottest gifts, from Kindle e-readers to Monster High dolls, were scarce or impossible to find.
Contrary to that report, however, Toys 'R' Us said in a press release it will "continue to receive daily deliveries of new products."
After the last-minute shopping ends on Christmas Eve, retailers take a break until Sunday.
"The day-after-Christmas brings all the shoppers back out," Nance said. Muncie Mall will open at 7 a.m. Sunday for after-Christmas sales.

description.hltext_display: US poised to approve nuclear arms pact with Russia
description.content:
WASHINGTON -- The Senate is poised to approve a nuclear arms pact with Russia, handing President Barack Obama a huge victory on his top foreign policy priority.
Passage of the New START treaty appeared assured after 11 Republicans joined Democrats in a vote Tuesday to end debate on the pact. That signaled that Obama should have the two-thirds majority he needs when the Senate votes on final approval Wednesday.
The approval would mark a big comeback for Obama's arm controls efforts after the treaty appeared all but dead just weeks ago. It also would allow Obama to continue efforts to improve relations with Russia.
Sen. John Kerry, D-Mass., left, and Sen. Richard Lugar, R-Ind., right, talk during a news conference about the New START Treaty on Capitol Hill in Washington Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010.
- Pablo Martinez Monsivais
Republican Whip Sen. Jon Kyl, R-Ariz., right, listens to Sen. Lindsey Graham, R-S.C., during a news conference about the New START Treaty on Capitol Hill in Washington Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010.
- Alex Brandon
Sen. John Kerry, D-Mass., right, and Sen. Richard Lugar, R-Ind., talk about the New START Treaty on Capitol Hill in Washington Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010.
- Alex Brandon
Sen. Richard Lugar, R-Ind., right, and Sen. John Kerry, D-Mass., talk about the New START Treaty on Capitol Hill in Washington Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010.
- Alex Brandon
Republican Whip Sen. Jon Kyl, R-Ariz., center, speaks as Sen. Jeff Sessions, R-Ala., left, and Sen. Lindsey Graham, R-S.C., stand nearby during a news conference about the New START Treaty on Capitol Hill in Washington Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010.
- Alex Brandon
Sen. John Kerry, D-Mass., and Sen. Richard Lugar, R-Ind., talk about the New START Treaty on Capitol Hill in Washington Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010.
- Alex Brandon
Ratification would mark a third recent major political victory for Obama, even though his Democratic party was trounced in last month's congressional elections. In recent days he won passage of a bipartisan tax deal and a vote ending the ban on gays openly serving in the military.
"We are on the brink of writing the next chapter in the 40-year history of wrestling with the threat of nuclear weapons," Foreign Relations Committee Chairman John Kerry, a Democrat, said after the vote.
The treaty would limit each country's strategic nuclear warheads to 1,550, down from the current ceiling of 2,200. It also would establish a system for monitoring and verification. U.S. weapons inspections ended last year with the expiration of a 1991 treaty.
The administration was adamant that it be ratified this year because the Democrats' majority in the Senate is set to shrink by five in January and waiting could have meant months of delay or defeat.
Republicans accused Democrats of rushing approval of the treaty for political reasons. They have asserted it would limit U.S. missile defense options and argued it has insufficient procedures to verify Russia's adherence.
When Jon Kyl, the leading Republican on negotiations over the treaty, suggested a delay last month, Obama appeared unlikely to find the nine Republican votes needed for passage.
But he and top members of his administration lobbied intensely, with Obama postponing his Christmas vacation in Hawaii. They enlisted support from top military officials and big-name Republicans from past administrations who argued the treaty was essential for U.S. national security.
In the end, they persuaded enough Republicans to defy the party's top two leaders in the Senate and support the pact.
"We know when we've been beaten," Republican Sen. Orrin Hatch told reporters hours before Tuesday's vote.
Even the Senate's No. 3 Republican, Lamar Alexander, endorsed the accord, saying he was assured U.S. defenses would not be weakened.
The treaty will leave the United States "with enough nuclear warheads to blow any attacker to kingdom come," Alexander said on the Senate floor.
Republicans had tried to kill the treaty by forcing changes in its language that would have sent it back for negotiations with Moscow. Democrats were working to appease some Republican senators by letting them raise these issues in legislation accompanying the treaty that would not directly affect the treaty.
Most Republicans remained opposed.
"The administration did not negotiate a good treaty," Kyl said. "They went into the negotiations it seems to me with the attitude with the Russians just like the guy who goes into the car dealership and says, 'I'm not leaving here until I buy a car.'"
Though Kyl looks likely to vote on the losing side of the debate over the treaty, in his negotiations with the administration he did win Obama's commitment to modernize the remaining nuclear arsenal with projected spending of $85 billion over 10 years.
Some of that money is now in the pipeline, contained in a stopgap government funding bill that cleared Congress on Tuesday. The measure would finance the government, mostly at current levels, through March 4.
It makes an exception for nuclear security programs, allowing the government to spend money to modernize the United States' nuclear arsenal at a rate equal to Obama's $624 million request.

Scientific studies(3) have proven that beta-alanine decreases fatigue in athletes and increases total muscular output. Strength-boosting magnesium with testosterone-supporting zinc and avena sativa one stop XTREME contains zinc monomethionine, the highest known quality form of zinc. description.hltext_display: Armed woman interrupts TV newscast in US:
description.author: Press Trust of India
description.content:
New York: An armed woman interrupted a live show in the US, after she burst into a television station on Tuesday wielding a gun, forcing the evening newscast off the air, the station has said.However, no one has been injured in the incident in North Carolina, ABC Charlotte affiliate 'WSOC-TV' said. After a brief standoff with a police special team that surrounded the building of the TV station, the woman was arrested. 'ABC News' said she had pulled out a gun and put it to her head though police later learned the gun wasn't loaded. The station went black during the incident at 5 PM but was back on air an hour later; employees were evacuated to the back section of a parking lot during the incident, The Daily Telegraph online reported."Not on air. Distraught woman with gun in lobby. Police have building surrounded. Employees evacuated," WSOC-TV anchor Blair Miller said in a message on the 'Twitter' site, from inside the station.Local police chief Rodney Monroe told WBTV that the woman threatened the receptionist and herself while they were barricaded in the building. Although police initially said the woman had fired at least one shot, Monroe later said no shots had been fired.
For NDTV Updates, follow us on Twitter or join us on

description.hltext_display: Под Новый год в Украине потеплеет до +17
description.content:
Во второй половине текущей недели в Украине ожидается дальнейшее повышение температуры воздуха, а также осадки в виде дождя и дождя с мокрым снегом.
Фоторепортажи
Видеогалереи
«Санта на продажу». ТРЕЙЛЕР
в Украину идет оттепель
В Киеве завтра -3/+2 градуса ночью, 0-5 днем. Дождь с мокрым снегом. В пятницу также осадки, туман. Ночью -3/+2, днем 0-5 градусов. В субботу ожидается дождь. Ночью 0-5, дневная температура - от 2 до 7 градусов. В Киевской области завтра ожидается дождь с мокрым снегом. Температура - от -3 до +2 градусов ночью, 0-5 градусов в дневное время суток. Ветер юго-западный, 5-10 м/с, сообщает Лигабизнесиформ.
На востоке в четверг 0-5 ночью, днем 4-9 градусов. Пройдет дождь, туман. В пятницу ночью 0-5 градусов, дневная температура 4-9 градусов. Также осадки. В субботу сухо. Температура -1/+4 градуса ночью, 3-8 градусов днем. Ветер юго-западный, 5-10 м/с.
На западе завтра ночью -2/+3 градуса, днем 1-6 градусов, пройдет дождь с мокрым снегом, туман. В пятницу также осадки. Температура воздуха ночью - около -2/+3 градусов, днем 1-6 градусов. В субботу ночью температура воздуха составит -1/+4 градуса, днем около 1-6 градусов, пройдет дождь. Ветер юго-западный, 7-12 м/с. Порывы до 15-20 м/с.
В южных регионах 23 декабря прогнозируют 2-7 градусов ночью, 7-12 днем. Без осадков, туман. В пятницу ночью - около 2-7 градусов, дневная температура 7-12, также сухая погода. В субботу переменная облачность. Ночью 1-6 градусов, днем 8-13 градусов. Ветер юго-западный, 5-10 м/с.
В Крыму завтра 5-10 градусов ночью, 11-16 днем. Без осадков, туман. В пятницу ночью 5-10, днем 11-16 градусов. Также сухо. В субботу ожидается переменная облачность. Ночью 4-9, днем 12-17 градусов. Ветер юго-западный, 5-10 м/с.
В центральных регионах ближайшей ночью -1/+4, днем 4-9 градусов. Пройдет дождь, туман. В пятницу осадки. Ночью около -1/+4 градусов, днем температура составит до 4-9 градусов. В субботу в основном сухо. Ночью градусники покажут около 1-6 градусов, дневная температура воздуха составит 3-8 градусов. Ветер юго-западный, 5-10 м/с.

description.hltext_display: Opel pisa el acelerador
description.content:
La situación en GM España ha dado un giro de 180 grados en menos de un año. Del negro al blanco sin pasar por el gris. Así ha sido el relato de la historia de Figueruelas en un 2010 "complicado" y claramente marcado por los efectos de la negociación sobre la venta de Opel, filial europea de GM. "Veníamos de una situación muy difícil", reconoció su presidente, Antonio Cobo, que ayer compareció en la factoría junto al director general comercial de Opel España, Enrico de Lorenzi y el director de Manufacturas de Opel/Vauxhall, Uwe Fechtner, durante el tradicional encuentro prenavideño con los medios de comunicación. Pero, salvado el escollo, la situación cambió radicalmente.
Tanto es así, que Cobo recalcó que la planta aragonesa producirá "bastantes más de 400.000 vehículos" el próximo año. En concreto, serán --según dijo-- "unos 40.000 más" que en el 2010. Es decir, una cifra superior a los 420.000 vehículos para una capacidad máxima instalada en la fábrica de 485.000. Un registro nada despreciable para los tiempos que corren en un sector que está de capa caída tras el fin de las ayudas públicas.
Pero los siguientes años serán también de bonanza. Así, la fábrica podría superar el récord de producción del 2007. "En el 2014 podemos llegar al nivel del mejor año, que fue el 2007", apuntó Cobo, tal y como adelantó el pasado 10 de octubre este diario. En concreto, las cifras que se manejan para ese ejercicio superan las 505.000 unidades. Además, se habla de 362.000 en el 2012 y 417.000 en el 2013. Se trata, en definitiva, de las previsiones del plan de Viabilidad de Opel revisadas por la compañía.
´EL COMBO´ VOLVERÁ Sin duda, la aportación del lanzamiento del nuevo Corsa y la llegada del Combo serán determinantes. Precisamente, Cobo casi dio por hecho que el Combo retornará a Figueruelas en el 2014, porque de lo contrario los 230 millones del plan de ahorro tendrían que retornar a los empleados y "nadie está por la labor de regalar" dinero, subrayó. Pero Figueruelas pisó el acelerador ya este año. Cerrará el ejercicio con más de 380.000 coches, aunque las previsiones hablaban de 330.000 (unos 52.000 más). Y todo ello gracias a la buena respuesta del Corsa --el modelo estrella de la planta y que tan bien ha respondido durante la crisis-- y al nuevo Meriva. No en vano, para el presidente de GM España el lanzamiento de este modelo "será el de mayor calidad en la historia de Opel/Vauxhall", si se confirman los datos, tanto internos como externos, subrayó Cobo. Entre abril y diciembre han salido de Figueruelas 90.000 Meriva.
Por tanto, el horizonte se despeja de tal forma que en el 2012 "podríamos volver a beneficios o a no pérdidas", aseguró Cobo, que tuvo un recuerdo emotivo para los trabajadores afectados por el accidente de autobús.

description.hltext_display: Harga Kebutuhan Pokok Masih Tinggi
description.content:
December 2010
Rabu. Harga barang kebutuhan pokok yang masih tinggi menyebabkan daya beli masyarakat menurun. Pembeli pun sepi. Demikian dikeluhkan beberapa pedagang di pasar tradisional Jakarta, Rabu (22/12).
Para pedagang menjelaskan, harga berbagai kebutuhan pokok hampir setiap hari naik, terutama beras dan cabai. Beras jenis paling murah IR 64, misalnya, harganya masih di kisaran Rp 7.500 per kilogram. Sedangkan harga cabai mencapai Rp 60 ribu per kilogram. Akibatnya, pembeli berkurang dan membuat sayur-sayuran layu dan rusak.
Penjual nasi goreng juga dibuat pusing karena tidak mampu membeli cabai yang harganya terus melonjak. Kenaikan serupa juga terjadi di daerah, seperti di Pasar Inpres Manonda Kota Palu, Sulawesi Tengah.

description.hltext_display: Obama signing 'don't ask, don't tell' repeal
description.content:
WASHINGTON -- Fulfilling a campaign pledge, cheering his party's downcast liberals and striking a blow for what he sees as basic human rights, President Barack Obama is signing a landmark law Wednesday that tells America's armed services to let homosexuals serve openly for the first time.
So many gay rights and Democratic activists were expected at the signing ceremony that the White House booked a large auditorium at the Interior Department.
"This day has come!" said an elated Mike Almy, an Air Force major discharged four years ago when his sexual orientation became known. "'Don't ask, don't tell' is over, and you no longer have to sacrifice your integrity."
Speaker Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif., right, applauds as former service members Sgt. First Class Stacy Vasquez, left, and current service member Lt. Col. Victor Fehrenbach, and former service member Major Mike Almy, hold the signed bill to repeal Don't Ask Don't Tell, during an enrollment ceremony on Capitol Hill in Washington Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010.
- Alex Brandon
While the elation is real, Pentagon officials caution it could be premature, since the bill requires service chiefs to complete implementation plans before lifting the old policy - and certify to lawmakers that it won't damage combat readiness, as critics charge.
Also, guidelines must be finalized that cover a host of practical questions, from how to educate troops to how sexual orientation should be handled in making barracks assignments.
While officials have avoided timetables, the process will probably take months.
Still, for gay and lesbian Americans, Wednesday is a watershed. And for Obama, it is a day to revel in the achievement of a goal he's long championed.
It is also the second of three expected victories in what's turned out to be - for Obama - a surprisingly productive lame-duck Congress. Weeks after his self-described "shellacking" in the midterm vote, he's won lopsided approval of a tax cut compromise, and the Senate is poised to deliver his top foreign policy goal: ratification of a new nuclear arms treaty with Russia.
Many Democratic liberals were furious over the tax package, believing Obama blithely yielded to Republican demands to retain the same tax cuts for the rich he had loudly denounced on the campaign trail. That's not the case with the repeal of don't ask, don't tell. Lifting of the ban on gays serving openly was something Obama not only campaigned on in 2008 but reiterated in this year's State of the Union speech.
"I will work with Congress and our military to finally repeal the law that denies gay Americans the right to serve the country they love because of who they are," he said in January to cheers in the House chamber, adding, "It's the right thing to do."
Born 17 years ago as a compromise between President Bill Clinton and a resistant Pentagon, the "don't ask, don't tell" policy became for gay rights campaigners a notorious roadblock on the way to full acceptance.
Speaking in June at a Gay Pride Month observance at the White House, Obama likened the fight to end it to the struggle of American blacks for civil rights.
"We have never been closer to ending this discriminatory policy," he declared.
Yet he has also faced rising discontent among gay activists who believed he hadn't moved forcefully enough. He's been heckled at campaign appearances over AIDS funding and the failure to end the military service ban.
Obama countered that as commander-in-chief, he had to ensure the ban's end is carefully prepared for.
That's just what the bill from Congress mandates.
"The implementation and certification process will not happen immediately; it will take time," Air Force Chief of Staff Gen. Norton Schwartz warned in an e-mail that went out right after Saturday's Senate vote. "Meanwhile, the current law remains in effect. All Air Force members should conduct themselves accordingly."
Military and administration officials are wrestling with numerous legal questions raised by the end of the ban - knowing that courts are waiting in the wings. They include what to do about pending expulsion proceedings, and when those ousted under don't-ask-don't-tell might apply to rejoin the armed forces.
For Almy, who appeared at a Capitol Hill ceremony Monday, the important thing is that gay and lesbian service members are no longer singled out because of who they love.
"That's all we ever wanted," he told reporters, "not special rights, just the same as our straight counterparts. "

description.hltext_display: MCC announces textbook rental program
description.content:
Morgan Community College Bookstore today announced it will begin offering textbook rental online at www.morganccbookstore.com this week. The program will offer savings that represent, on average, 75 percent off the price of new books.
“We are eager to launch textbook rental because we are committed to providing students with affordable textbook choices,” said Anita Ertle, Director of Bookstore Services. “Offering additional textbook purchase options gives our students a new level of savings and convenience. It is an especially welcome option for students at our Bennett, Burlington, Limon and Wray Centers. The books can be ordered online 24/7 and delivered directly to the student’s home. You do not have to be an MCC student to take advantage of our rental option. It is as simple as accessing our bookstore website and clicking on the rental link to start saving money on textbooks!”
MCC’s Bookstore textbook rental program:
·Includes tens of thousands of the most popular textbook titles for rental
·Saves students money on the course materials they need to succeed academically
·Provides students with a new option for their course materials needs
·Is available to students online at www.morganccbookstore.com
·Allows students the freedom to highlight and take notes all within the normal wear and tear associated with coursework
For more information about the program, visit www.morganccbookstore.com

description.hltext_display: Biogen power plant set to rise in Agusan Norte
description.content:
NASIPIT, Agusan del Norte, Philippines – The Caraga Region, particularly the province of Agusan del Norte, will no longer be affected by power cut if the state-owned power corporation will push through in reducing their energy power supply to electric cooperatives in Mindanao due to the looming lack of power supply early next year.
The Biogen project developer, a European power firm, has started negotiating a long-term bilateral Renewable Energy Supply Agreement (RESA) with the Agusan del Norte Electric Cooperative (ANECO) who will then be the main off-taker for the electricity to be generated by the project, it was learned Wednesday.
The project developer of the Nasipit Biogen Power Plant (NBPP) proposes to use coconut wastes and other agricultural wastes as fuel to power a combined heat and power plant that will produce electricity during the first phase, and copra, vegetable oil, and biodiesel during the second phase, it was also learned.
Initially, the entire plant facility will consist of a 10-megawatt (MW) biomass power island and the biomass fuel system.
The biomass power island will utilize a combustion technology based on the step-grate system that is able to flexibly handle various biomass fuels in different sizes and moisture contents.
The Biogen project also intends to utilize coconut husks and fronds, agricultural waste from corn, abaca and rice, as well as sawdust from mills within the area.
Aside from electricity as the major and primary product, the project will subsequently develop other products in its various phases as dictated by market and investment forces.
It has also the option of adding waste heat recovery (cogeneration) systems to generate process steam that can be used to produce copra, biodiesel, desiccated coconut or distilled water from coconut juice.
Studies made by the European Biogen explorers who were already here found that there is enough fuel to consistently supply the needs of the project.
The project will not only provide an inexpensive, stable and sustainable source of electricity but will also increase the disposal income of farmers supplying fuel, it was further learned.
The Nasipit Economic Zone in the town of Nasipit in Agusan del Norte has been identified as a site for the multi-million-peso project.
As of press time, the European power developer is closely coordinating with the different local government unit officials and other power energy stakeholders for further documentation and processing of other papers for the proposed operation of the Biogen project that is tentatively targeted start in 2011.

description.hltext_display: Fight looms after Texas gets 4 new US House seats
description.content:
AUSTIN, Texas -- A surge of Hispanic residents and other population gains have Texas poised to add more congressional clout than any other state, but a partisan fight now looms over exactly where the new seats should go.
Texas is gaining four seats in the U.S. House, twice as many as Florida, the only other state to pick up multiple ones, according to new population figures announced Tuesday by the U.S. Census Bureau. All told, Republican-leaning states will pick up at least a half dozen House seats thanks to the 2010 census, which found the nation's population growing more slowly than in past decades but still shifting to the South and West.
With Texas Republicans using recent elections to fortify their already solid control of the state Legislature, the political process of redrawing the state's congressional map would seem to benefit the GOP, too.
Census Bureau Director Robert Groves announces results for the 2010 U.S. Census at the National Press Club, Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010 in Washington.
- Jacquelyn Martin
Census Director Robert Groves announces results for the 2010 U.S. Census at the National Press Club, Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010 in Washington.
- Jacquelyn Martin
Census Bureau Director Robert Groves announces results for the 2010 U.S. Census at the National Press Club, Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010, in Washington.
- Jacquelyn Martin
Census Bureau Director Robert Groves announces results for the 2010 U.S. Census at the National Press Club, Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010 in Washington.
- Jacquelyn Martin
UPDATED: Graphic shows changes in state population.
- S. Chen
Census Director Robert Groves announces results for the 2010 U.S. Census at the National Press Club, Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010 in Washington.
- Jacquelyn Martin
CORRECTS total number of seats for Texas to 36 in the âReapportioning the House Seatsâ chart; graphic shows changes in state population and which states will be gaining or losing congressional seats and compares U.S. growth over last decade with other developed countries4
- W. Castello
Census Bureau Director Robert Groves announces results for the 2010 U.S. Census at the National Press Club, Tuesday, Dec. 21, 2010 in Washington.
- Jacquelyn Martin
But Democrats say not so fast.
Boyd Richie, chairman of the Texas Democratic Party, said Hispanic and black population growth account for the additional seats, and he vowed to fight for a redistricting plan that takes their numbers into account.
"A legal and fair redistricting process must produce new congressional districts that reflect the Hispanic and African American population growth," Richie said. "Our Democratic numbers may be down, but we are not out. Democrats cannot and will not allow our voices to be silenced in this critical process."
The Census Bureau said the nation's population on April 1 was 308,745,538, up from 281.4 million a decade ago. The growth rate for the past decade was 9.7 percent, the lowest since the Great Depression. The U.S. population grew by 13.2 percent from 1990 to 2000. Michigan was the only state to lose population during the past decade. Nevada, with a 35 percent increase, was the fastest-growing state.
The new numbers are a boon for Republicans, with Texas leading the way among GOP-leaning states that will gain House seats, mostly at the Rust Belt's expense. Following each once-a-decade census, the nation must reapportion the House's 435 districts to make them roughly equal in population, with each state getting at least one seat.
In all, the census figures show a shift affecting 18 states taking effect when the 113th Congress takes office in 2013. The political power follows the high population growth, shifting toward the south and west and away from the industrial Midwest and northeast.
With reapportionment settled, the far more politically divisive process of redistricting is set to begin. In Texas, both major parties were bracing for a showdown over the state's new residents, beginning a fight that is sure to spark court action. But with Republican supermajorities in the Legislature, the temptation to run the table will be strong.
Rep. Pete Gallego, D-Alpine, said if the federal courts don't intervene to compel fairness, Republicans will likely produce a map that gives their party the advantage in three or perhaps even all four of the new seats.
"It is very easy to overreach when you're holding the map and have the pen in your hand," he said.

description.hltext_display: Make a day of it at Delvera Farm Village
description.content:
If you need to do some last minute Christmas shopping AND keep the kids occupied, take a trip out to Delvera Farm Village in the beautiful Stellenbosch winelands.
Comprising more than 20 independently owned businesses, Delvera has something for everyone.
Enjoy lunch under the trees
I paid the village a visit recently and lunched at the Simonsberg Café (the Simonsburger with pepper sauce is delicious, by the way) before taking a stroll through the grounds.
The Delvera estate is a popular wedding venue, as well as a great picnic spot. You can enjoy your lunch from the restaurant out under the trees at one of the tables in the gardens while your little ones explore the climbing frame.
Shop for Christmas gifts
When you've had a bite, you can stock up on your outstanding Christmas gifts at one of the cottage shops - foodies will love some olives or any of the offerings from the popular Chrisna's Olives and Deli, or a bottle of 'garage wine' from Topaz Wines.
Visit The Little Wool Shop for clothes, jewellery, handknits and unique gifts, or for creative family and friends, you might find a present at Johan Swart Ceramics and Thou Art Useful, which sell beautiful ceramic and mosaic creations.
Keep the kids entertained
While you browse the Aspidistra Nursery for plants, seeds and pots, the kids can have fun petting one of the gorgeous little rabbits that live in the nursery. An aviary of assorted birds will also keep them amused while you pick up gifts for green-minded friends.
Alternatively, put your child on the resident pony for a ride, or bring your kids' bikes along so they can play on Dirtopia Trail Centre's pump track or toddler's bike track. I would have loved this when I was small and had a little black plastic motorbike!
SA Boot Camp's children's obstacle course will also keep them occupied for hours, or if you find yourself there on a Sunday, you can deposit them at the Children's Farm Theatre, which puts on a show every Sunday at 12 noon.
Outdoorsy adults will be happy to hear that there are also three marked cross-country trails to Klapmuts-koppie and the Terrain Park trail. For night owls, Dirtopia also offers full moon hikes from Delvera. These will be taking place on 19 January, 18 February, 19 March and 18 April 2011.
It's nice to get out of the city (and away from shopping mall madness!) for a day, so be sure to put Delvera on your holiday itinerary.
The Farm Village is open seven days a week. For more information call 021 888 44 352 or email info@delvera.co.za.
Author info: Rebecca Dodd
All4Women's assistant editor Rebecca Dodd completed her undergraduate degree in Print Journalism and her Honours in English Studies at UCT. She has worked as a writer and copy editor for a publishing house and a PR agency, but has recently gone part-time in PR in order to dedicate more time to her passion – writing for women and for the web. In her spare time she reads (books and blogs), cooks, watches vacuous teen dramas and eats ice cream straight from the tub.

description.hltext_display: El juez advierte a la alcaldesa por realizar una contratación irregular
description.author: IRENE BAJO
description.content: El Juzgado de lo Contencioso-Administrativo Número 3 de Santander ha advertido a la alcaldesa de Ampuero, Nieves Abascal, sobre las irregularidades cometidas en la contratación de una persona para trabajar en las dependencias de la Ludoteca del Consistorio y condenado a la regidora a «adoptar las medidas precisas para que se cumplan los procedimientos legalmente establecidos y se garanticen los principios de igualdad, publicidad, capacidad y mérito en el acceso al empleo público a través de la contratación laboral de duración determinada». El fallo estima el recurso presentado por el grupo popular en el Ayuntamiento de Ampuero frente a la administración demandada en relación con la contratación de personal temporal. Según explicó ayer su portavoz, Patricio Martínez Cedrún, la resolución parte de una demanda presentada por los populares al percatarse de que en el Ayuntamiento «estaban contratando recurrentemente a la misma persona para trabajar en la ludoteca». Martínez explica que la empleada era contratada por periodos de seis meses y era dada de baja días antes de concluirse su contrato, por lo que volvía a ocupar las listas del Inem. Posteriormente, la alcaldesa, Nieves Abascal, solicitaba a este organismo una empleada pidiendo los requisitos que ella reunía, como experiencia trabajando en la ludoteca, por lo que de nuevo volvía a ser ella la que ocupaba el mismo puesto. Informe en contra El portavoz popular añade, además, que estos hechos se venían produciendo a pesar de los avisos e informes contrarios a la contratación que emitía el propio secretario del Ayuntamiento «por no cumplirse las bases públicas de contratación de personal». También, que el grupo popular requirió a la alcaldesa para que remediara esta situación en un pleno, «pero nuevamente volvió a contratarla en enero de este año haciendo caso omiso del informe contrario del secretario, por lo que nos vimos obligados a presentar la demanda». Martínez incidió, además, en la posibilidad de que esta situación «podía dar lugar a que la empleada formulara una demanda solicitando la plaza fija del puesto que lleva desempeñando desde hace más de tres años». La sentencia, conocida ayer, da la razón a la parte demandante, que en este caso es el Partido Popular, y lleva implícita un apercibimiento a la propia alcaldesa de Ampuero, a la que advierte sobre esta situación irregular que, en el supuesto caso de que volviera a repetirse, el Grupo Popular volverá a denunciar ante la Justicia. Preguntada al respecto de la sentencia conocida ayer, la alcaldesa de Ampuero, Nieves Abascal, rehusó hacer cualquier tipo de comentario al respecto.

description.hltext_display: Konstanz bereits schneefrei
description.content:
Offenbach/Konstanz (dpa) - Konstanz am Bodensee ist der einzige Ort ohne Schnee in den bundesweiten Messungen des Deutschen Wetterdienstes DWD.
Diesen Artikel versenden
Absender *
Absender-Email *
Empfänger *
Empfänger-Email *
Nachricht *
Mr Wong Webnews Digg del.icio.us Yahoo Google Technorati Yigg Alltagz
Die Stadt im äußersten Süden Deutschlands war mit Stand vom Dienstagabend schneefrei und verzeichnete in der Nacht zum Mittwoch mit plus drei Grad eine in diesen Tagen milde Temperatur.
Alle übrigen über ganz Deutschland verteilten 64 Orte, von denen die DWD-Zentrale in Offenbach Schneehöhen abruft, waren eingeschneit. An der Spitze lag der Brocken im Harz, wo sich die Flocken auf 155 Zentimetern Höhe stapelten. Auf der Zugspitze waren es nur fünf Zentimeter weniger. Selbst auf den Nordseeinseln Norderney, Sylt und Helgoland blieb die weiße Pracht liegen - was dort selten ist.
Allerdings sagten die Meteorologen in ihrer ersten Prognose am frühen Mittwochmorgen Tauwetter für den ganzen Süden voraus. Im Laufe des Tages könnte der Schnee dort also an vielen Orten fortschmelzen.

description.hltext_display: Im Norden kalt, im Süden mild
description.content:
Offenbach (dpa) - Temperaturen über dem Gefrierpunkt bringen Schnee und Eis zumindest in Süddeutschland vielerorts zum Schmelzen. « », bilanzierte der Deutsche Wetterdienst DWD im hessischen Offenbach am frühen Mittwoch. Mit Stand von 4.00 Uhr am Morgen lagen die Temperaturen in Konstanz, Stuttgart und Frankfurt am Main im Plusbereich. In München waren es null, in Nürnberg minus ein Grad. Köln und Dresden lagen mit einem Grad geradeso im Plus.
Ein Mädchen arbeitet in Wenzenbach (Oberpfalz) an einem Wikingerschiff aus Schnee. Die Meteorologen in haben Tauwetter für den ganzen Süden vorausgesagt.
Weiter gen Norden wurde es kälter, beispielsweise mit minus sechs Grad in Hannover, minus sieben Grad in Bremen und Rostock, minus fünf in Hamburg und minus acht Grad in Berlin. Dieses Temperaturgefälle zwischen Nord und Süd soll laut DWD-Prognose generell anhalten, wobei jedoch die milderen Temperaturen in die Mitte Deutschlands vorrücken.
In Baden-Württemberg und Bayern war das Tauwetter schon am frühen Morgen vielerorts zu beobachten, wie eine Umfrage bei den größeren Polizeidienststellen ergab. Leichte Plusgrade gab es fast überall.
Für den Heiligabend am Freitag sagt der DWD für weite Teile Deutschlands leichten Schneefall voraus. Bei Temperaturen um den Gefrierpunkt soll es zunächst am Vormittag in Berlin, Frankfurt/Main, Stuttgart und München noch Regen oder Schneeregen geben, zum Abend hin wird es dann laut Prognose aber deutschlandweit leicht schneien.

description.hltext_display: LOI SRU - Logement social : quatre mauvais élèves côte-d’oriens
description.content:
Des logements sociaux en construction au boulevard Champollion à Dijon (agence Caradec et Risterucci). Photo Philippe Bruchot
Quatre. C’est le nombre de communes déficitaires en logements sociaux en Côte-d’Or. Qu’est-ce qui l’explique ? Qu’est-ce qui est fait pour changer la situation ? Nous avons fait le point.
Des logements sociaux en construction au boulevard Champollion à Dijon (agence Caradec et Risterucci). Photo Philippe Bruchot
Quatre. C’est le nombre de communes déficitaires en logements sociaux en Côte-d’Or. Qu’est-ce qui l’explique ? Qu’est-ce qui est fait pour changer la situation ? Nous avons fait le point.
Dijon, Fontaine-lès-Dijon, Marsannay-la-Côte, Saint-Apollinaire. Telles sont les communes de Côte-d’Or qui n’atteignent pas encore les 20 % de logements sociaux rendus obligatoires par la loi relative à la Solidarité et au renouvellement urbains (SRU), votée en 2000 et appliquée depuis 2002. Parmi elles, seules trois (Fontaine-lès-Dijon, Marsannay-la-Côte et Saint-Apollinaire) doivent payer l’amende. En effet, la ville de Dijon n’est pas concernée car elle a plus de 15 % de logements sociaux (16,2 %) et qu’elle bénéficie d’une Dotation de solidarité urbaine (DSU). Au 1 er janvier 2009, il manquait 2 949 logements à loyers modérés à Dijon.
Au Grand Dijon, on indique qu’à la même date, les 22 communes de la communauté d’agglomération dijonnaise disposaient d’un parc social de 22 036 logements, soit 18,8 % des 117 111 résidences principales ; le déficit était de 3 870 logements à loyers modérés.
Mauvaise volonté ?
Les quatre communes déficitaires en logements sociaux font-elles preuve de mauvaise volonté ? Non. Interrogés hier sur leurs performances, tous les représentants de ces communes déclarent être « très volontaristes ». « Je souhaite avoir ces 20 % le plus rapidement possible », indique Jean-François Gondellier, maire (sans étiquette) de Marsannay-la-Côte, commune qui a environ 9 % de logements sociaux (il en manquait 240 au 1 er janvier 2009). « Nous utilisons tous les leviers possibles pour parvenir à cet objectif (constructions neuves sur des terrains vierges, achat de terrains viabilisés, etc.) », déclare Patrick Chapuis, maire (UMP) de Fontaine-lès-Dijon, qui a un taux de logements sociaux de 7,6 % (il en manquait 503 au 1 er janvier 2009) et qui est le plus mauvais élève du département. « Avec François Rebsamen, nous avons mis les bouchées doubles, en construisant massivement, pour rattraper le retard dont nous avions hérité en 2001 », estime Pierre Pribetich, adjoint au maire (PS) de Dijon délégué à l’urbanisme. « De plus, les 22 communes du Grand Dijon, dont les quatre déficitaires au titre de la loi SRU, ont signé des engagements qui nous situent dans des cycles vertueux. Ils s’évertuent à appliquer le retard en matière de logements à loyers modérés », ajoute le vice-président du Grand Dijon. « Sur 1 700 nouveaux logements par an dans l’agglomération, plus de la moitié sont à loyer modéré. »
Un des problèmes rencontré par ces quatre communes déficitaires en logements sociaux concerne le manque de foncier. « Nous n’avons plus de réserves foncières sur Marsannay », note Jean-François Gondellier, qui évoque aussi l’importance des vignes sur la commune. Un autre frein évoqué concerne l’image, parfois négative, qu’ont les logements sociaux auprès de certains habitants. Et l’on peut facilement comprendre l’importance de cette question, surtout d’un point de vue électoral.
« Je veux réaliser cette loi avec des logements sociaux qui s’intègrent bien dans le paysage de Fontaine », explique Patrick Chapuis. « Cela passe par de petites opérations, de 10 à 20 logements. Bien sûr, il serait facile d’arriver aux 20 % en construisant une grande tour. Mais le but n’est pas de faire du logement pour faire du logement. »
Même discours à Marsannay : « Il ne s’agit pas de faire n’importe quoi n’importe où. Il faut respecter la population qui est concernée. » Pareil à Saint-Apollinaire (13,4 % de logements sociaux, soit un manque de 178 logements de ce type au 1 er janvier 2009). « On ne peut pas uniquement appréhender le logement social d’un point de vue qualitatif », explique Rémi Delatte, le maire UMP. « Il faut aussi une approche qualitative et humaine. Il ne faut pas reprendre des schémas que nous avons connus à une époque et qui se sont soldés par des échecs. »
VINCENT LINDENEHER v.lindeneher@lebienpublic.fr
Les conditions de la loi SRU
L’article 55 de la loi n° 2000-1208 du 13 décembre 2000, relative à la Solidarité et au renouvellement urbains (SRU), fixe aux communes de plus de 3 500 habitants (1 500 en Ile-de-France), situées dans les agglomérations de plus de 50 000 habitants, comprenant au moins une commune de plus de 15 000 habitants, de disposer d’au moins 20 % de logements locatifs sociaux par rapport à leur parc de résidences principales.
Les communes Concernées par la loi
Seules 10 communes de Côte-d’Or entrent dans le champ d’application de l’article 55 de la loi SRU (voir encadré). Au 1 er janvier 2009, les pourcentages de logements sociaux dans les communes concernées par la loi SRU sont les suivants, du moins bon élève au meilleur : Fontaine-lès-Dijon (7,6 %), Marsannay-la-Côte (8,7 %), Saint-Apollinaire (13,4 %), Dijon (16,2 %), Chevigny-Saint-Sauveur (21,7 %), Beaune (22 %), Talant (28,3 %), Quetigny (33 %), Longvic (33,8 %), Chenôve (45,3 %).
E. bouet : « en très bonne voie »
« Cette loi relative à la Solidarité et au renouvellement urbains (SRU) n’a pas été remise en cause, ni par la droite, ni par la gauche », note Emmanuel Bouet, directeur de l’Union sociale pour l’habitat (USH) de Bourgogne. « En France, il existe encore quelques communes qui font tout pour ne pas avoir de logements sociaux. Par exemple, Neuilly-sur-Seine continue à ne pas vouloir de logements sociaux et à préférer payer l’amende plutôt que d’en construire… Mais en Bourgogne, je ne pense pas que cela existe. En Côte-d’Or, toutes les villes ne sont pas en conformité, mais nous sommes en très bonne voie pour y arriver et même aller au-delà. Y compris dans le Grand Dijon, les villes ont le souhait et la volonté de rattraper le retard. La tension qu’il peut parfois y avoir sur ce sujet dans l’agglomération dijonnaise n’a rien à voir avec ce que l’on trouve en Ile-de-France. » Il poursuit : « Le problème en région parisienne est très spécifique, car les logements sont concentrés sur quelques communes. En conséquence, cela va être très long d’arriver à un rééquilibrage. » Selon Emmanuel Bouet, sur le territoire du Grand Dijon, « nous avons la chance d’avoir du foncier disponible ». Il estime que cette politique d’avoir 20 % de logements sociaux dans les communes de plus de 3 500 habitants est « positive », car, sur certains territoires, « il n’y avait pas d’offre qui correspondait à une population très modeste ».

description.hltext_display: Fellegi: nem lesz orosz tulajdon a Malévban
description.content:
Fellegi Tamás nemzeti fejlesztési miniszter szerint januárban megegyezés születhet az oroszokkal a Malév sorsáról; a légitársaság iránt két komoly érdeklődő is van - a miniszterrel a szerdai Napi Gazdaság közöl interjút.
Mik ezek?
×
A sorban látható gombokkal a webes közösségi hálózatokon - iWiW, Facebook - fejezheted ki egy kattintással tetszésedet vagy
oszthatod meg a cikkel kapcsolatos véleményedet ismerőseiddel.
"Tetszik" / "Like" gomb. Ezzel a gombbal a Facebookon fejezheted ki tetszésedet a cikkel kapcsolatban - üzenőfaladon
egyszerűen csak annyi jelenik meg, hogy kedveled ezt a cikket. Ha most éppen be vagy jelentkezve a Facebookra, akkor azt is
látod, hogy ismerőseid közül valakinek tetszett-e már ez az írás. Ha nem vagy bejelentkezve, a gomb megnyomása után ezt
egyszerűen megteheted. (Ez a gomb tényleg csak egy szimpla tetszésnyilvánítás - ha a cikkel kapcsolatban egyből véleményt is
megosztanál, akkor használd a cikk alatti szürke hátterű sorban található "Facebook" feliratot.)
"Megosztás az iWiW-en" gomb. Ezzel a gombbal a legnépszerűbb magyar közösségi oldalon, az iWiW-en tudsz tartalmat
megosztani. A felugró ablakban beírhatod véleményedet is, és ha épp nem vagy bejelentkezve, egyben azt is megteheted.
A lap szerdai számában megjelent terjedelmes nyilatkozatban a miniszter közölte, hogy a továbbiakban nem lesz orosz tulajdon a magyar légitársaságban.
Fellegi Tamáselmondta, hogy január közepén-végén lehetséges a következő oroszországi tárgyalási forduló. Az előkészítése során az energetikai együttműködési csomag témája közelebb van a megoldáshoz, a Molban lévő orosz Surgutneftegas (Szurgutnyeftegaz) tulajdonában lévő részvénypakettről folyó tárgyalások már lassabban haladnak.
A Paksi Atomerőmű bővítésének orosz közreműködésére vonatkozó kérdésre Fellegi Tamás azt válaszolta: szerencsésnek tartaná, ha több országból származó vállalatok alkotnának konzorciumot a pályázatra. Megjegyezte: az atomerőmű bővítéséről az orosz mellett német, francia, amerikai, finn és dél-koreai partnerekkel is folytak már megbeszélések.
A minisztérium azt javasolja a kormánynak, hogy az atomerőmű bővítésről a tél folyamán döntsön. Fellegi Tamás megemlítette, hogy a tárca elkészítette az energiastratégiát, ami hamarosan a kormány elé kerül. Ennek jóváhagyása után lehet foglalkozni a paksi bővítés időzítésével és módjával. Ekkor határoz a kormány a finanszírozás kérdésében is. A döntés előkészítéséhez a nemzeti fejlesztési minisztérium legalább három verziót készít.
"Az Új Széchenyi Tervet (ÚSZT) január 15. környékén hirdetjük meg" - nyilatkozta a miniszter, hozzátéve, hogy a tárca foglalkozik olyan konstrukcióval is, amelyek hitelformájú támogatást adnak kis- és közepes vállalkozásoknak.
A negyedik mobilszolgáltatói pályázatra vonatkozó kérdésre pedig azt mondta: a tendert esetleg 2011-ben lehet kiírni a magyarországi piaci mozgásoktól függően.
A tárca elkészítette az egységes személyszállítási törvény tervezetét, ami várhatóan hamarosan a kormány elé kerül. Ezzel együtt dönt a kormány arról, hogy a közösségi közlekedési holding milyen szervezetben és finanszírozási rendben dolgozzon.
Fellegi Tamás szólt arról is, hogy áttekintették az összes PPP (public private partnership) programot, amelynek elkészítették a jogi és a pénzügyi értékelését is. A kisebb értékű szerződéseknél tárgyalásokat kezdeményeztek a partnerekkel. A miniszter beszélt arról is, hogy vannak olyan PPP-programok, amelyeknek rövid távon tervezik a visszavásárlását, állami kivásárlását. A döntés már megszületett arról, hogy egyes esetekben milyen megoldást szeretne a kormányzat. Gyakorlatilag mindenre akad példa a kulturális jellegűtől az oktatásig - kivéve a börtönépítési projekteket.
Paksi Atomerőmű Zrt. - az elmúlt évek árbevétele

description.hltext_display: Android 2.3 update for Nexus One to arrive soon
description.content:
Good news for HTC Nexus One owners. A Gingerbread treat is definitely on the way for you… soon.
The Android 2.3 update for Google's retired smartphone is due out in the "coming weeks". Not exactly precise, unfortunately.
Perhaps it's just time to move on to the Nexus S with Gingerbread preloaded. Are any of you anxiously awaiting the arrival of Android 2.3 on the Nexus One?
Read more of "Nexus One getting Android 2.3 Gingerbread update soon" at ZDNet.com.

description.hltext_display: "Alguien que paga 1.000 nóminas al mes me produce admiración"
description.content: El presidente de la CREA, Jesús Morte, dijo sentirse "contento" tras la elección de Rosell. "Tiene el perfil necesario, es abierto y con una gran capacidad empresarial. Alguien que paga 1.000 nóminas al mes me produce respeto y admiración", señaló. Lo que no sabe es si seguirá como vicepresidente. "Con la reducción de miembros, el puesto se ha puesto bastante caro. Yo estaré a lo que me diga", añadió. Por su parte, el presidente de la Cámara de Comercio de Zaragoza, Manuel Teruel, destacó el talante empresarial, abierto y dialogante del nuevo presidente.

description.hltext_display: “国产刀魂”最新视频 采用虚幻3引擎
description.content:
由中国台湾地区公司游戏橘子研发的虚幻3网游《Core Blaze》公开最新游戏视频，《Core Blaze》不论从人设还是动作上都颇有《刀魂OL》样子，游戏橘子在上海设有分公司，这款游戏不论是在台湾还是在内地，玩家都能玩到这款“国产刀魂”。
游戏橘子研发团队倾力制作，使用次世代引擎Unreal Engine 3开发、东方大型3D动作角色扮演在线游戏《Core Blaze》，于今日公开最新游戏画面影片。在今年东京电玩展举行的媒体限定发表会中，《Core Blaze》以原创世界观及突破性高自由度的玩法，赢得世界各地众多媒体的好评，并十分关注《Core Blaze》的开发进度。此次借着影片发布，将让玩家一窥《Core Blaze》当中“高自由度”游戏设定、武器攻击的“写实动作”展现等特色，同时也首次释出主要四大武器情报。

description.hltext_display: 网帖称交通局专设局长水箱 回应:为更好使用水箱
description.content:
订东北网彩信手机报，移动发TX到10628007，联通发DBWY到1065566600，电信发DBWY到10628999。
东北网手机版 3g.dbw.cn
局长专用水箱，其他人等回避?
回应：告示本意是为更好地使用水箱
局长专用厕所、局长专用车位、局长专用网球场……近日，“局长专用牌”网络热词阵营又添新成员――“局长专用水箱”。
12月20日，华声、猫扑等多家论坛都出现了题为“唐山路北交通局局长真牛”的网帖，一个贴有“此处只供局长们喝水”告示的电水箱，将唐山路北交通局推向舆论的风口浪尖。
网帖：“此处只供局长们喝水”
“此处只供局长们喝水”――在网帖提供的图片中，记者都看见了这样一则告示。告示同时提醒相关人员注意，“其他同志到别的地方打水”。
发帖网友称，照片拍摄于路北交通局局长办公楼门口，并指出“办公室担心局长们没开水喝给局长们弄了个专用水箱”。
记者调查发现，该贴最早出现在唐山本土论坛，其后被全国各家论坛广泛转载。截止记者发稿时，已有数十家网络论坛转发贴文，网友议论纷纷。
网友“瓜洲河的渔夫”连连感叹，“太牛了!只为领导服务啊，服务太周到了”；网友“月朗风轻”则尖锐地指出，对特权的崇拜已深入到官场的各个角落；也有网友质疑，“现在办公室都有饮水机了，还用得着贴这个告示？”
回应：告示本意是为更好地使用水箱
20日下午，唐山路北交通局办公室工作人员告示记者，该交通局大楼有两层，二楼有5个局长办公室，楼道里只有一个小水箱，一楼却有两个水箱。二楼水箱因打水人多、烧干烧坏过多次。该工作人员称，贴出此告示的本意是“为了更好地使用电水箱”。该工作人员还表示，该局局长办公室没有饮水机，“不明白网上为什么会出这么多评论”。

description.hltext_display: 清潔工/CHN/china
Windows Phone 7 sells 1.5 mil – or not
description.author: Oliver
description.content:
Photo: Microsoft Microsoft has been very forthcoming with its Kinect sales statistics, but not so much with its Windows Phone 7 units shipped numbers, until now. Apparently they’ve shipped 1.5 million phones over a 6 week time period , but these figures don’t reflect actual sales . Microsoft’s last chance We’ve covered the Windows Phone 7 build up and critical reception extensively. Basically, the new mobile OS is Microsoft’s last ditch effort to remain relevant in an increasingly important smartphone world dominated by Apple, Android and, to a lesser extent, BlackBerry and Nokia. Of course, what we’ve all been dying to know is whether MS have managed to successfully pull off this effort and just how well they’re doing. Now we know, well, sort of, at least. Photo: Microsoft 1.5 mil sold…to retailers In a very forward-looking press release yesterday, the vice president of Microsoft’s mobile division finally let loose some sales statistics and other interesting tidbits of info on the current status of WP7. Cutting to the most interesting part first, it seems that MS have sold 1.5 million handsets in the first 6 weeks of the mobile operating system’s existence – though only to retailers and network providers , not actual customers, that is. Not actual sales stats Yes, these figures are only actually for the amount of phones Microsoft has shipped off to retailers and don’t reflect the much more important figure, namely the amount purchased by customers. On this front Microsoft have been far more vague and subdued, with mobile vice president Berg only saying that sales have ‘met expectations’ and are in keeping with the performance of other new mobile platforms – in other words, they haven’t been all that great. Photo: HTC WP7 a failure? Even though MS has been skirting around the issue of sales, it seems clear they have no intentions of pulling the plug on Windows Phone 7 anytime soon, like with the KIN phone disaster. From the latest press release, it’s evident the company is looking to the future with confidence , even though they admit they’re facing some very well entrenched and established competition. Why the bad start? Unlike the KIN, Windows Phone 7 is actually a good product . It’s OS interface is inventive, fluid and easy to use. Plus, the gaming offered by the Xbox Live integration is basically unmatched among mobile phones today, even counting the iPhone. So why the failure to catch on? Well, there are a few important reasons. Lack of quality handsets First off, although the Windows Phone 7 OS and interface are very original and perform well, they haven’t been paired with any truly remarkable handsets . Yes, the HTC 7 Trophy or LG Optimus 7 are good phones, but nothing too original or spectacular. To sell a phone you need both excellent software and hardware, the latter of which WP7 handsets lack for the most part. A rumoured Nokia marriage could solve this dilemma, however. Need more apps The big buzzword nowadays when it comes to smartphones is apps, and, as a new OS, WP7 currently trails far far behind Apple and Android . Although they’re off to a great start with 4000 apps and counting on the WP7 marketplace , they still have a long ways to go in order to offer the same quality and variety available on more established platforms. With that said, MS does have a leg up in terms of games, thanks to its peerless WP7 Xbox Live integration .
Click here to view the embedded video.
Too much competition Then of course there’s the factor that MS themselves appear to be alluding to most: the competition. With Android’s recent explosion this year, and iOS4′s continuing dominance, there just hasn’t been much room for Windows Phone 7 to establish itself , or learn from its mistakes. Instead, the launch version of WP7 has had to compete with both the highly polished iOS4 and latest Android 2.2 (now 2.3) editions – a tough task. Plenty of hope left Although we don’t know for sure, from these latest figures and the attitude of mobile vice president Berg, it’s safe to say Windows Phone 7 smartphones aren’t doing too spectacular, nor for that matter are they failing abysmally . With rumours that WP7 might be included on Nokia phones in the future, and more apps and OS improvements coming online, there’s still a very good chance for WP7 to firmly establish itself in the future as a real contender.

description.hltext_display: '3G in India: Operator Launch Strategies' and Other Research Reports by Ovum Available at MarketPublishers.com
description.content:
LONDON, Dec. 22, 2010 /PRNewswire/ -- Market Publishers Ltd informs that new in-demand market research reports by Ovum have been added to its catalogue. . The report describes data services targeted at specific market segments, provides the key to faster returns on network investments. The research provides the information on the operators that are now planning their network rollout and service strategies and discusses 3G launch strategies in India … . Banks are back in the market for global network services, with technology and manufacturing companies joining them as key innovators in communications. The report provides a detailed analysis of the global service providers...
America Movil. The research dwells on the company focus on bundled offerings and multi-play services as well as expanding 3G network capacity to drive the next phase of growth. The research discusses strategic objectives and the process of integration of newly acquired operations and stiff competition from regional and local players as key challenges … . The report provides a detailed analysis of how current MTRs were determined across the EU15 and look at how NRAs are taking the Recommendation into consideration as they undertake new market analyses. The research discusses EC recommendations aimed at harmonizing the charges across Europe … . This report describes the main HSPA+ enhancements brought by 3GPP R8, R9, and R10. It also offers early trends for these future HSPA+ options. The report provides technical overview of HSPA evolutionary options and mobile broadband connection forecasts for 2009-2015 …
More new market research reports by Ovum can be found at http://marketpublishers.com/members/ovum/info.html

description.hltext_display: Pequim pro�be uso do ingl�s em textos chineses
description.content:
Para preservar a "pureza" da língua chinesa, os jornais, revistas, livros e sites da China ficarão proibidos de utilizar termos em inglês, anunciou uma agência governamental.
"O uso crescente de palavras e abreviaturas em inglês prejudica gravemente a padronização e a pureza da língua escrita e oral chinesa", afirma uma diretriz divulgada na segunda-feira pela Administração Geral da Imprensa e Edição, e publicada nesta quarta-feira pelos jornais.
"Este hábito destrói um entorno linguístico e cultural saudável e harmonioso, e exerce uma influência nefasta na sociedade", completa o texto.
"Em consequência fica proibido introduzir termos estrangeiros como palavras ou abreviaturas inglesas nas publicações em chinês e criar termos que não são chineses nem estrangeiros, de significado pouco claro".
As empresas que não respeitarem a diretriz podem receber sanções administrativas.
Algumas siglas em inglês são usadas regularmente pela imprensa chinesa, como NBA (a liga de basquete profissional dos Estados Unidos), GDP (Produto Interno Bruto, PIB em português), CPI (índice de preços ao consumidor) e WTO (Organização Mundial do Comércio, OMC em português).
A Administração permite, no entanto, a possibilidade do uso de termos estrangeiro em caso de necessidade, seguidos da tradução ou de uma explicação em chinês.
Os nomes dos locais ou de pessoas deverão ser igualmente traduzidos, segundo o jornal de língua inglesa China Daily, que publica as declarações do diretor de uma editora de Pequim com críticas à medida.
"A intenção de proteger a língua chinesa é boa, mas com a globalização, quando certas siglas em inglês como WTO (Organização Mundial do Comércio) são amplamente aceitos pelos leitores, eliminá-las me parece exagerado", declarou a fonte, que pediu para não ser identificado.
"Na conversa, as pessoas também utilizam estas palavras todo o tempo, a regulamentação pode distanciar a língua escrita da oral", considerou.

description.hltext_display: HG Hill reopens as midstates first Food Saver
description.content:
Fairview area consumers were surprised in early December when they discovered the doors locked on the HG Hill grocery. But it turned into a pleasant surprise a little over a week later when the doors reopened on Fairviews new Food Saver grocery store.
Store manager Todd Murphy says, It is a name and concept change. Our family still owns the store and we are looking forward to serving the great people of Fairview for years to come.
With the Publix coming soon, the owners saw the need for a value-driven grocery store in Fairview and decided on the cost-plus format. We are the first cost-plus format in Middle Tennessee, confirmed Murphy.
Murphy said he is pleased with the communitys response to the change.
Overall, the reaction has been extremely positive, said Murphy. Customers are seeing the pricing advantage we can offer. In this tough economy, many customers are expressing this is exactly what Fairview needed. As an independent store operator, the Murphys felt the change was needed in Fairviews ever-changing marketplace. Our customers have been very receptive to the change and feel it was a step in the right direction, shared Murphy.
Of course, making the decision to change was only the first step. Actually changing a grocery store requires a lot of planning. There was a lot of ground work put in place for our decor, signs, pricing and countless other changes, explained Murphy. Along with the lower prices, there are other noticeable changes. We will be offering our customers greater buying opportunities as well as the best Pick 5 meat program in the area. You'll find a noticeable improvement in our meat department with greater size choices and we are using only choice beef, which is one of the best grades of beef you can buy, remarked Murphy.
With the aggressive pricing strategy in the meat and produce departments, the new Food Saver also has a greater selection of dollar store items plus Murphy says they still carry all of the favorite national brands such as Kraft, Tide, Del Monte, etc. that our customers are looking for.
